Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can include and label different types of plants and animals in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, and squirrels.
The student can include and label different types of plants and animals in the water habitat, such as fish, clams, and aquatic plants.
The student can show and compare the different types of living things found in each habitat.
The student can demonstrate how certain plants and animals are specific to the type of habitat they live in using their drawings.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently identify patterns in the diversity of plants and animals between the two habitats (e.g., sometimes forgetting to label a common species or not clearly showing certain adaptions specific to habitat).
The student may have minor gaps in labeling, such as occasionally omitting a label or using a less precise term (e.g., 'creature' instead of 'aquatic animal').
